title: Gary Barlow locked in battle with conservationists over plans for massive garage
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Music world legend Gary Barlow is embroiled in a struggle with conservationists over plans to turn part of his country home into a garage for his impressive car collection.

Gary's logged plans for the update to his Cotswolds home - the plans would see The Paddocks, part of the £6 million property known as The Old Rectory, receive a reworking to house his motors.

The 48 year old first bought the fancy pad back in 2007 as a country getaway.

Now he wants to bulldoze some of The Paddocks for his cars and also create a gardening shed while he's at it. The area will also undergo a major re-landscaping project, with flower beds, ornamental trees and lavender and shrub borders with brick paving.

(Image: Getty Images)

Local council conservationists, though, reckon the planned project would threaten any rare bat species that might be hiding about the gaff, as well as Great Crested Newts, which are under the law's protection.

Miranda Clark, who's a conservationist on the West Oxfordshire District Council, said in planning documents: "The photograph of the existing The Paddocks building appears to show timber bargeboards, dormer windows and cladding that is in poor condition, including loose timber edging, which highlights that there might be roosting potential for bats."

Miranda goes on to say it's very likely that there'll be Great Crested Newts somewhere about.

(Image: West Oxfordshire District Council)

(Image: West Oxfordshire District Council)

The Rule The World singer's property agent, A&J D'Alton said in planning documents that part of The Paddocks has been "unused and unoccupied since 2012 and is an extremely poor build and considered aesthetically harmful to the character and quality of The Old Rectory to which it is still attached."

Mirror Online has reached out to representatives of Gary for comment.

He's not the only big name in the area, as The Grand Tour's Jeremy Clarkson, footballing legend David Beckham and supermodel Kate Moss all have pads nearby.

Gary's recently buried the hatchet with Strictly: It Takes Two host Rylan Clark-Neal after a seven year feud.

The pair clashed when X Factor hopeful Rylan made it much further on the show than judge Gary reckoned he should have done.

But Rylan tweeted a snap of the pair looking chummy at a party, writing: "After 7 years...we're good."
description: The Take That singer wants to turn part of his Cotswolds mansion into a a garage for his mighty collection of flashy motors
